intro: Daucus gingidium subsp. drepanensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean carrot, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its root system is less developed compared to other carrots, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure.
